Returns available code lists

Source: R/api.R
ecb_codelist.Rd

Returns available code lists

Usage

ecb_codelist(agency = NULL, id = NULL)

Arguments

agency

character(1) the agency to query. Defaut NULL.

id

character(1) id to query. Default NULL.

Value

A data.frame with the available code lists. The columns are:

id

The id of the code list

name

The name of the code list

References

https://data.ecb.europa.eu/help/api/metadata

See also

Other metadata: ecb_data_structure()

Examples

ecb_codelist()
#> # A tibble: 145,806 × 3
#>    agency id             name                                                   
#>    <chr>  <chr>          <chr>                                                  
#>  1 ECB    CLI_EONIA_BANK EONIA code list for banks                              
#>  2 ECB    CLI_EONIA_BANK EONIA Total/aggregate                                  
#>  3 ECB    CLI_EONIA_ITEM EONIA item code list                                   
#>  4 ECB    CLI_EONIA_ITEM Weighted average rate                                  
#>  5 ECB    CLI_EONIA_ITEM Volume                                                 
#>  6 ECB    CLI_LM_ITEM    Liquidity manag. balance sheet item code list          
#>  7 ECB    CLI_LM_ITEM    Gold and gold receivables                              
#>  8 ECB    CLI_LM_ITEM    Claims on non-euro area residents denominated in forei…
#>  9 ECB    CLI_LM_ITEM    Receivables from the IMF                               
#> 10 ECB    CLI_LM_ITEM    Balances with banks and security investments, external…
#> # ℹ 145,796 more rows
# or filter by id
ecb_codelist(id = "CLI_EONIA_BANK")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 3
#>   agency id             name                     
#>   <chr>  <chr>          <chr>                    
#> 1 ECB    CLI_EONIA_BANK EONIA code list for banks
#> 2 ECB    CLI_EONIA_BANK EONIA Total/aggregate
